JobFullDesc: Job SummaryA Director of Engineering is an established leader in the Product Development organization. They may or may not have direct reports that they manage. The key attribute of a Director is leadership - either leading the efforts to build better products or leading and developing the engineering staff to become a leading software development organization.The Director of Engineering must communicate with a wide variety of individuals both inside of and outside of the development organization and is responsible for helping to align those groups and individuals to move the entire organization forward. A Director has responsibility for the technical vision and evolution of a significant portion of the product suite or product platform. They evaluate and manage the technical decisions and innovations to ensure that the work done across multiple product areas is well coordinated and aligned with the overall strategic plan for product development.A Director may also have responsibility for managing multiple teams of product development staff including Product Development Managers, Architects, and Engineers. This includes coaching, leadership development and mentoring to enhance individual development and overall department and team performance. They provide managerial oversight of the performance and development of the product development managers to ensure a high level of performance and innovation in alignment with product development objectives.Key accountabilities include synchronizing product development of multiple teams and ongoing customer discovery work to ensure customer satisfaction and achieving revenue targets from new
